name: Creeping Zinnia
climate: Creeping Zinnia thrives in temperate climates with moderate temperatures.
It can also adapt to sub-tropical climates, enjoying warm conditions.
This plant is not frost-tolerant and should be protected from freezing.
Humidity levels are generally not a concern for Creeping Zinnia.
sunlight: Creeping Zinnia prefers full sunlight exposure for healthy growth.
Partial shade can be tolerated but may reduce flowering frequency.
It's best planted in a location where it receives morning sun and afternoon shade.
Avoid deep shade areas, as insufficient light can stunt its growth.
watering: Regular watering is essential, especially during dry periods, to keep it thriving.
Ensure the soil stays moderately moist but avoid waterlogging the plant.
It's crucial to allow the top couple of inches to dry out between waterings.
Reduce watering during the cooler months to prevent root rot.
soil: Creeping Zinnia grows well in well-draining soil with good organic content.
A sandy loam soil type with slightly acidic to neutral pH is ideal.
Make sure the soil is aerated to prevent water retention and root diseases.
It can tolerate poorer soils but will not perform as well in such conditions.
extra_care_tip: Regular deadheading of blooms encourages more prolific flowering.
Mulch around the base to conserve moisture and suppress weeds.
Fertilize with a balanced plant fertilizer during the growing season for best results.
Protect it from lawn equipment and foot traffic, as it can be quite delicate.
